basics.name: Jason Wilczak
basics.label: AVP of Software Engineering at Travelers & Freelance Software Engineer
basics.summary: Hardworking, self-driven, deterministic individual always looking for a challenge.  I am a software engineer with the thirst for knowledge and a heavy desire to learn the latest technologies.  My passion lays with developing new applications and solutions with emerging technologies.  That being said, I sincerely hope to be able to work on a game at some point in my career.

work.name: Travelers
work.summary: As an AVP of Software Engineering, I run the API Platform circle and the Software Engineering Chapter for our Organizational Unit.

work.name: Travelers
work.summary:
I am now responsible for the API Strategy of Travelers.  My circle is tasked with paving the direction of API development and technology for the future of the company.  Our goal is to find the right balance of API standards and governance for all engineers leveraging AWS and MuleSoft.

In addition to my daily circle lead focus, I also manage the TLDP program and support the Engineering Chapter for our business group.  I believe building a solid engineering culture needs to be the foundation of any company looking to remain competitive in the digital landscape.

work.name: Travelers
work.summary:
Lead Software Engineer on the Customer Access and Identity portfolio.  Technologies used include: C#, JavaScript, React, HTML5/CSS3, ASP.NET MVC, .NET Core, WebAPI, WCF, SQL Server, NodeJS, Express, Mongo, AWS, PCF, UCD, Jenkins, SVN, Github, Visual Studio (full and Code), Okta, MuleSoft, OpenShift, Rally, and Confluence

Also responsible for Engineering culture activities around development of engineers, quality of life, onboarding, etc.  Ran the first Engineer community of practice for our area and helped pave the foundation for the enterprise community of practice.

work.name: Travelers
work.summary: Senior Software Engineer in charge of the Agent portal for external facing agents.  Used C#, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Visual Studio, SQL Server, PCF, IIS, Rally, and Confluence.

work.name: ReadyEDI
work.summary: Freelance contract work for ReadyEDI.  Responsible for web based solutions leveraging C# MVC and WCF as well as VueJS for the front end.  Primary responsibility includes building/maintaining a custom CMS platform built, custom form and input screens, components, workflows and designing the look and feel of the website using Vuetify.

work.name: Avanade
work.summary: Software developer responsible for .NET technologies for various clients and projects.  Strong focus in JavaScript and ASP.NET (MVC) skill sets.

work.name: KTI
work.summary:
Software Development using C# .Net.  Projects have ranged from middleware development using XML schemas to asp.net deeply interactive web applications.  The current project is using Silverlight 4 (eventually 5) with the Prism framework and the MVVM pattern to develop a large scale client application.
Most of my work is involved on the User Interface logistics, not the graphic design work.  I also maintain some service side logic and help maintain the databases (SQL Server).  When it is time, I also do the application roll-out/installs into the customer environment and provide training and high level support.

work.name: technical metal finishing
work.summary: Mechanical Engineering with regards to aerospace engine parts.

work.name: Technical Metal Finishing
work.summary: I ran the machines that would handle the surface treatments of the aerospace engine parts.

certificates.name: MS: Programming in HTML5 with JavaScript and CSS3
MS: Essentials of Developing Windows Store Apps using HTML5 and JavaScript

references.name: Swapna Varghese
references.reference: Jason is very creative and intelligent  and a very good team member to work with. He has good technical capabilities and a techie with good logical and analytical skills in Software design and development.
